intro: Callista fairfaxii, commonly known as the fairy bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Callista fairfaxii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest margins and rocky areas.
